respondentID.label: Respondent-ID
respondentID.description: Assigned by your federal regulatory agency. Format is right-justified and zero filled.

timestamp.label: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Format is century, year, month, day, hour, minute (e.g., Jan. 17, 2013, at 1:30 pm would be 201301171330)

totalLineEntries.label: Total Line Entries
totalLineEntries.description: The N of line entries contained in the accompanying Loan/Application Register

parentZip.label: Parent Zip Code
parentZip.description: If applicable; format is 99999 left-justified or 99999-9999

contactName.label: Contact Person's Name
contactName.description: For questionable data, reports, or other issues that may arise during an annual processing cycle.

respondentEmail.label: Contact Person's E-mail Address
respondentEmail.description: Enter only one e-mail address. E-mail address must contain only one @ symbol. Format is left-justified.

Application or Loan Number.label: Application Number
Application or Loan Number.description: Enter an identifying loan number that can be used later to retrieve the loan or application file. It can be any number of your institution's choosing (not exceeding 25 characters). You may use letters, numerals, or a combination of both.

dateApplicationReceived.label: Date Application Received
dateApplicationReceived.description: Enter the date the loan application was received by your institution by month, day, and year. If your institution normally records the date shown on the application form you may use that date instead. Enter “NA” for loans purchased by your institution. For paper submissions only, use numerals in the form MM/DD/YYYY (for example, 01/15/2003). For submissions in electronic form, the proper format is YYYYMMDD.

loanType.label: Type of Loan or Application
loanType.description: Indicate the type of loan or application by entering the applicable Code from the following:

codes.1: Conventional (any loan other than FHA, VA, FSA, or RHS loans)

codes.4: FSA/RHS-guaranteed (Farm Service Agency or Rural Housing Service)

propertyType.label: Property Type
propertyType.description: Indicate the property type by entering the applicable Code from the following:

codes.1: One-to four-family dwelling (other htan manufactured housing)

notes.a: Use Code 1, not Code 3, for loans on individual condominium or cooperative units.

notes.b: If you cannot determine (despite reasonable efforts to find out) whether the loan or application relates to a manufactured home, use Code 1.

loanPurpose.label: Purpose of Loan or Application
loanPurpose.description: Indicate the purpose of the loan or application by entering the applicable Code from the following:

notes.a: Do not report a refinancing if, under the loan agreement, you were unconditionally obligated to refinance the obligation, or you were obligated to refinance the obligation subject to conditions within the borrower's control.

ownerOccupancy.label: Owner Occupancy
ownerOccupancy.description: Indicate whether the property to which the loan or loan application relates is to be owner-occupied as a principal residence by entering the applicable Code from the following:

Codes.2: Not owner-occupied as a principal dwelling

notes.a: For purchased loans, use Code 1 unless the loan documents or application indicate that the property will not be owner-occupied as a principal residence.

notes.b: Use Code 2 for second homes or vacation homes, as well as for rental properties.

notes.c: Use Code 3 if the property to which the loan relates is a multifamily dwelling; is not located in an MSA; or is located in an MSA or an MD in which your institution has neither a home nor a branch office. Alternatively, at your institution's option, you may report the actual occupancy status, using Code 1 or 2 as applicable.

loanAmount.label: Loan Amount
loanAmount.description: Enter the amount of the loan or application. Do not report loans below $500. Show the amount in thousands, rounding to the nearest thousand (round $500 up to the next $1,000). For example, a loan for $167,300 should be entered as 167 and one for $15,500 as 16.

notes.a: For a home purchase loan that you originated, enter the principal amount of the loan.

notes.b: For a home purchase loan that you purchased, enter the unpaid principal balance of the loan at the time of purchase.

notes.c: For a home improvement loan, enter the entire amount of the loan—including unpaid finance charges if that is how such loans are recorded on your books—even if only a part of the proceeds is intended for home improvement.

notes.d: If you opt to report home-equity lines of credit, report only the portion of the line intended for home improvement or home purchase.

notes.e: For a refinancing, indicate the total amount of the refinancing, including both the amount outstanding on the original loan and any amount of “new money.

notes.f: For a loan application that was denied or withdrawn, enter the amount for which the applicant applied.

preapprovals.label: Request for Preapproval of a Home Purchase Loan
preapprovals.description: Request for Preapproval of a Home Purchase Loan. Indicate whether the application or loan involved a request for preapproval of a home purchase loan by entering the applicable Code from the following:

notes.a: Enter Code 2 if your institution has a covered preapproval program but the applicant does not request a preapproval.

notes.b: Enter Code 3 if your institution does not have a preapproval program as defined in §1003.2.

notes.c: Enter Code 3 for applications or loans for home improvement or refinancing, and for purchased loans.

actionTaken.label: Type of Action Taken
actionTaken.description: Indicate the type of action taken on the application or loan by using one of the following Codes.

Codes.8: Preapproval request approved but not accepted (optional reporting)

notes.a: Use Code 1 for a loan that is originated, including one resulting from a request for preapproval.

notes.b: For a counteroffer (your offer to the applicant to make the loan on different terms or in a different amount from the terms or amount applied for), use Code 1 if the applicant accepts. Use Code 3 if the applicant turns down the counteroffer or does not respond.

notes.c: Use Code 2 when the application is approved but the applicant (or the loan broker or correspondent) fails to respond to your notification of approval or your commitment letter within the specified time. Do not use this Code for a preapproval request.

notes.d: Use Code 4 only when the application is expressly withdrawn by the applicant before a credit decision is made. Do not use Code 4 if a request for preapproval is withdrawn; preapproval requests that are withdrawn are not reported under HMDA.

notes.e: Use Code 5 if you sent a written notice of incompleteness under §1002.9(c)(2) of Regulation B (Equal Credit Opportunity) and the applicant did not respond to your request for additional information within the period of time specified in your notice. Do not use this Code for requests for preapproval that are incomplete; these preapproval requests are not reported under HMDA.

actionDate.label: Date of Action
actionDate.description: For paper submissions only, enter the date by month, day, and year, using numerals in the form MM/DD/YYYY (for example, 02/22/2003). For submissions in electronic form, the proper format is YYYYMMDD.

notes.a: For loans originated, enter the settlement or closing date.

notes.b: For loans purchased, enter the date of purchase by your institution.

notes.c: For applications and preapprovals denied, applications and preapprovals approved but not accepted by the applicant, and files closed for incompleteness, enter the date that the action was taken by your institution or the date the notice was sent to the applicant.

notes.d: For applications withdrawn, enter the date you received the applicant's express withdrawal, or enter the date shown on the notification from the applicant, in the case of a written withdrawal.

notes.e: For preapprovals that lead to a loan origination, enter the date of the origination.

respondentID.label: Respondent-ID
respondentID.description: Assigned by your federal regulatory agency. Format is right-justified and zero-filled.

loanNumber.label: Loan/Application Number
loanNumber.description: Unique identifier across the home office and branch sites

metroArea.label: Metropolitan Statistical Area/Metropolitan Division
metroArea.description: Metropolitan Statistical Area or Metropolitan Division (if appropriate) code or NA left-justified

fipsState.label: State Code
fipsState.description: FIPS code with leading zerosor NA left-justified

fipsCounty.label: County Code
fipsCounty.description: FIPS code with leading zeros or NA left-justified

censusTract.label: Census Tract
censusTract.description: Include decimal point and any leading or trailing zeros or NA left-justified

applicantIncome.label: Applicant Income
applicantIncome.description: Report in thousands, round to the nearest thousand with leading zeros and without commas or NA left-justified

rateSpread.label: Rate Spread
rateSpread.description: Enter the rate spread to two decimal places. Include the decimal point and any leading or trailing zeros or NA left-justified
